alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 1:41PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Spalding, southeastern Fayette, northern Meriwether, northwestern Pike and southeastern Coweta Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 141 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Moreland, or 7 miles south of Newnan, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Peachtree City, Senoia, Grantville, Luthersville, Brooks, Moreland, Sharpsburg, Turin, Haralson, Lone Oak, Gay, East Newnan, Concord, Rocky Mount, Starrs Mill, Hollonville, Alvaton, Digbey, and Lake Horton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
